result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order on Attyorney Drewa's Motion to Withdraw
Order on Attorney Drewa's Motion to Withdraw

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott Glenn Schofield in custody and by Attorney Timothy Drewa.  Atty. Drewa requests to withdraw from this case and SPD to appoint new counsel if approved.  Defendant wishes to withdraw his waiver on preliminary hearing.  State takes no position on defendant's request.  Court denies defendant's request to withdraw waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court approves withdrawal of Atty. Drewa.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with newly appointed counsel.  Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott Glenn Schofield in court in custody and by Attorney Timothy Drewa.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Timothy Drewa.  Court finds probable cause on amended criminal complaint.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years. No contact with ACS or her residence.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody and by Atty. Timothy Drewa.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.   Argument on bond.  State requests $250,000 cash bond.  $250,000 cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with appointed counsel.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
